Class GoogleApiZxing

java.lang.Object
com.prototype.model.apis.GoogleApiZxing
public class GoogleApiZxing extends Object
Provides utility methods for generating, converting, saving, and reading QR codes using the ZXing library. This class encapsulates the complete logic for creating QR matrices, producing images, decoding QR content, and storing QR images.
Version:
1.5 author Jorge Forero

  • Method Details

    • createQr

      public static com.google.zxing.common.BitMatrix createQr(String codeQR) throws Exception
      Creates a BitMatrix representation of a QR code from a given string.
      Parameters:
      codeQR - the text to encode into the QR code
      Returns:
      a BitMatrix containing the encoded QR data
      Throws:
      Exception - if encoding the QR code fails

    • generateImagen

      public static BufferedImage generateImagen(com.google.zxing.common.BitMatrix bitMatrix)
      Converts a BitMatrix into a rendered QR code image.
      Parameters:
      bitMatrix - the QR code represented as binary matrix data
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage containing the rendered QR code

    • generateImagen

      @Deprecated public static void generateImagen(com.google.zxing.common.BitMatrix bitMatrix, String urlString) throws Exception
      Deprecated.
      replaced by improved image handling methods
      Converts a BitMatrix into a QR code image and saves it to a file path selected by the user.
      Parameters:
      bitMatrix - the binary matrix containing the QR code
      urlString - the destination path (without extension)
      Throws:
      Exception - if writing the file fails

    • bufferQr

      public static String bufferQr(BufferedImage image)
      Attempts to decode a QR code from a provided BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      image - the image containing the QR code
      Returns:
      the decoded QR text, or null if no valid QR code is found

    • saveQrToPictures

      public static void saveQrToPictures(BufferedImage image, String fileName) throws Exception
      Saves a QR code image to the user's default Pictures directory.
      Parameters:
      image - the QR code image to save
      fileName - the name of the output file, excluding extension
      Throws:
      Exception - if writing the image file fails
